James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars.

To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: Documentary following the fortunes of humans and animals over the course of a year in Alaska, which is by far the biggest US state and still one of the wildest places on Earth with deep forests and vast mountain ranges. The arrival of spring sees Alaska go through a huge transformation as water, light and warmth return, with animals emerging from hibernation and rushing to cash in on the riches of the season. Dougray Scott narrates.

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: The land is bathed in 24-hour sunlight during the short Alaskan summer, luring hummingbirds up from Mexico, exposing deserts in the Arctic and relying on parachuting firefighters to tackle forest fires in its vast wilderness. Grizzly bears fatten up on a sudden wealth of salmon, a caribou calf joins a vast herd on its great migration and a huge male moose finds unlikely ways to impress a female. Among the human population, a dedicated grower of giant vegetables takes his half-ton pumpkin to the Alaska State Fair.

programme.title: Alaska: Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: To survive the bone-chilling cold, deadly blizzards and darkness of the eight months of an Alaskan winter takes courage, cunning and remarkable endurance. This episode tells the stories of how the tough and resourceful animal and human inhabitants of the windswept mountain peaks, icy tundra and snowbound forests face up to the challenges of the season.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live in volcanic hot spots on the ocean bed, areas that reach temperatures hot enough to melt lead and which may hold the secrets behind all life on Earth. Other strange creatures from the depths of the sea include bone-eating worms, fish that walk rather than swim, and hordes of squid. Plus, footage of sharks in a feeding frenzy over the dead body of a whale and the wildlife of the Midnight Zone in the Pacific, an area that never receives any natural light, forcing creatures to rely on their own bioluminescence.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Highclere Castle, the setting used for TV drama Downton Abbey, including an insight into the lives of current residents Lord and Lady Carnarvon.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden history of the stately home in Derbyshire, the residence of the dukes of Devonshire, revealing tales of intrigue, tragedy and scandal.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn rides up Mount Snowdon's railway to visit the summit station, and discovers how a glass structure envelopes Strasbourg's 19th-century station.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: A marine biologist and a deep-sea diver explore Chuuk Lagoon, one of the world's greatest underwater graveyards, for a wreck discovered by sonar nearly 20 years ago.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The forgery of Hitler's diaries in the 1980s, which fooled several respected historians and news publications, and brought to light the thriving trade in Nazi memorabilia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep underground.

programme.title: Murder Maps

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to the Royal Hall in Harrogate, with Alastair Dickenson giving his highest valuation in 20 years on the show. programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the scenery of rural and coastal Scotland as he travels from Stirling to John O'Groats. programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: TV and radio presenter Chris Tarrant goes on three journeys by rail through some of the world's harshest terrain. Chris sets off on his scheduled two-day trip from the station at the port of Pointe-Noire, ending his journey six days - and a whole series of setbacks - later.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Brenda makes it clear that she thinks Neville is living it up in Germany just as a leather-clad local girl, whom he merely shared a taxi with, accuses him of assaulting her. Cult comedy drama, starring Kevin Whately, Tim Healy and Julia Tobin.

programme.desc: The coral and shipwrecks found off the shores of the tropical islands, and how the different kinds of reef have given rise to a huge diversity of underwater life in the area. programme.title: Mission: Kill Hitler
programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. Two soldiers parachuted into the area were supposed to find a perfect location to shoot Hitler and stop the devastating war. Based on the British Secret Services' declassified documents, using archives and fictionalised reconstitutions, this film recounts the full story and the detailed plan that should have led to the murder of Adolf Hitler, and explains why it failed..

Andy McConnell examines the oldest piece of glass he has seen in his career, and Fiona is challenged to spot a 2500-year-old Greek vessel among three fakes.

programme.desc: The effects of the region's powerful hurricanes on the islands' wildlife and the survival stories of some of the species, including how the Puerto Rican parrot almost became extinct. Offshore, lobsters head to deeper waters for refuge, while reefs benefit from the destruction.

programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line

programme.title: The Day They Dropped the Bomb
programme.desc: Documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the day the world's first atomic bomb was detonated above the Japanese city of Hiroshima on August 6, 1945. Featuring a minute-by-minute account of what happened on that tragic day, through archive footage and interviews with eyewitnesses who rarely speak about their experience of the bombing. Also interviewed is navigator Theodore Van Kirk, who was the last surviving member of the crew who dropped the bomb, before his death in 2014.

Andy McConnell examines the oldest piece of glass he has seen in his career, and Fiona is challenged to spot a 2500-year-old Greek vessel among three fakes.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Salisbury in Wiltshire to Castle Cary, Somerset, visiting a world-famous tourist spot that has been captivating visitors since the Victorian era. He also takes to the air in Yeovil and tries his hand at clothmaking the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the third leg of his journey from London to Newton Abbot, Michael Portillo travels from Taunton to Minehead. Along the way he explores a church, finds out just what it takes to operate a 19th-century signal box and summons all his strength to move a 110-ton steam locomotive.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Wild Caribbean

programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol's attempts to give Sonia a birthday she will remember go awry, Sanjay makes an enemy of Ian, and Pat is forced to face some home truths about life after Frank.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline's worried about Michelle and asks Mark to talk to her. Nigel finds out there's a thief about. Carol has problems with a criminal nearer home, and Phil fights with Jimmy.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called to a factory where a man has been crushed, while Carole's future is uncertain. Elsewhere, a resident complains about the siren noise from the station.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: An old friend of Will's requests his help to commit suicide in order to protect his family from the stigma associated with his illness - Aids. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Skelthwaite struggles to adjust to the loss of Sally Boothe, as husband Billy vows revenge for a rugby team's prank rather than face the reality of his wife's death. Anna and Kim welcome the latest recruit, excitable trainee Zoe Phelps, while the hospital staff attempt to make a young heart transplant patient's wish come true. Lesley Dunlop and Denise Van Outen star.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon makes a go of it at the cafe, but Tracey finds it hard to feel pleased for her. Meanwhile, Dorien becomes preoccupied with more romantic pursuits. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey finds herself under suspicion after a valuable piece of DeVere's antique china mysteriously disappears while she helps him catalogue his collection. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy makes an ill-advised attempt to establish long-distance communication with Compo and Clegg by investing in some walkie-talkies. However, it doesn't take long for one of the units to fall foul of a tractor. Long-running rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy are intrigued by some perfectly respectable men who turn up without their trousers, before they take part in an event sponsored by a village charity.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A middle-class couple's adopted child is kidnapped, a case that takes Gently and Bacchus to a home where unmarried mothers are forced to give up their babies. Suspicion initially falls upon the natural mother, who is thought to have 'stolen' her baby back. But further investigations reveal a much darker side to the adoption home itself and raise questions as to how far this seemingly perfect couple were prepared to go to become parents. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Mark Gatiss, Helen Baxendale and Alison Steadman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team pursues a serial killer with a grisly desire to look at his victims' faces as they die, and the trail leads into the world of academic philosophy. However, Nikki is distracted from the case by the death of her grandmother, while Harry investigates the demise of a woman who apparently drowned in three inches of water.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called to a factory where a man has been crushed, while Carole's future is uncertain. Elsewhere, a resident complains about the siren noise from the station.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol's attempts to give Sonia a birthday she will remember go awry, Sanjay makes an enemy of Ian, and Pat is forced to face some home truths about life after Frank.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads are bemused after they are ordered to capture a dangerous escaped panther, and wonder if they are the victims of a hoax. Meanwhile, Evans is disturbed to learn a friend may be bullying an Asian soldier.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: An old flame from Northern Ireland turns up on Sergeant McLeod's doorstep with his six-year-old son in tow - a development his wife is not too pleased about. Jeremy has an embarrassing date with Melanie, and soon realises he has more in common with her mother - but she is married to his commanding officer.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane and Kyla speculate about Dan's involvement with Abra's sudden departure. Sam asks Chrissie to join him at a work dinner, but she feels suffocated by his concern for the baby. Meanwhile, a mystery man provides an opportunity for Jac. Medical drama, starring Peter Wingfield and Rakie Ayola.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dan is furious with Charlie for closing the department without informing him, but Charlie says that it was the director of nursing who made the decision. Meanwhile, Amy is forced to rethink her career when her son and his childminder are involved in an accident and Holly receives a mysterious visitor. Derek Thompson, Grant Masters and Rebecca Wheatley star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. As a tearful Laura Bryant is sent home on compassionate leave, a witness provides a breakthrough, and the trail of evidence leads back to Michael Keenan, the barman at gay club Radar. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita is fired from her job. Meena is sent away by Sanjay. Arthur receives a summons, and Phil lies to Kathy about how he hurt his hand.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil loses his rag, while Grant loses his motor, and Gita pays Ian back in more ways than one.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are caught up in a horrific street disturbance when vigilantes set fire to a suspected pedophile's car. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The village is shocked when a dead baby is discovered on the moors and a homeless teenage girl is suspected of being the mother. The police launch an appeal for information but their only clue is a silver crucifix found nearby. Medical drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly guest stars as factory worker Barry, whose shocking secret is revealed when Zoe goes to give a healthy eating talk at his firm. The trainee nurse also finds romance with a sexy stranger, while Harding is concerned about the arrival of an old rival in Skelthwaite. The rugby pitch gets waterlogged - so Billy persuades his team-mates to try cookery classes. Drama, with Andrea Lowe.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey looks forward to mothering Garth, but his lack of enthusiasm puts Sharon in a difficult position. Meanwhile, Dorien discovers a lust for learning - and her new psychology lecturer. Comedy, starring Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Arthur Smith makes his annual visit to Grantleigh, but as he happens to be a tramp, DeVere becomes concerned about his presence. Guest starring Bill Travers (Born Free).

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Walking Stiff Can Make You Famous
programme.desc: Feeling frustrated by his lack of fame, Foggy invents the sport of bicycle polo, convinced it will not only put his name in lights but prove a lucrative venture. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo seizes the opportunity to break into the world of showbusiness when human cannonball Captain Zero cannot perform his act at the local garden fete. Trevor Peacock (The Vicar of Dibley) guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: The detective investigates a blackmailer at large on the London debutante scene by planting old friend Lord Robert Gospell as a mole. However, the pair fail to prevent a murder. Feature-length drama, starring Patrick Malahide and Harold Innocent.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki investigates a man's apparent suicide and begins to suspect foul play after two more deaths occur, leading to recently released mental patient David Nicholson being accused of their murder. While the doctor treating Nicholson is adamant that he is no threat to anyone, the pathologists are not convinced - especially when a connection with the original victim emerges.

programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Kids' documentary series looking at what it takes to become a professional at all kinds of exciting jobs. Agent Danny is back at school, but this time he's the teacher..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is babysitting the Neighbours' toddler. The baby flees and kidnaps Fizz mistaking him for a plush toy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a machine which stops toast from landing butter-side down. Magoo sees some floating toast and believes a ghost is haunting their house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is on a beach and that sailors are emptying their oil tanker right into the ocean..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, Iris and the turtles are playing a game of ping pong when a mysterious aged turtle arrives on the patio and gets hit by the ball..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons find a brilliant way of getting into the Mikkelsen's's house without anyone noticing by getting mailed to the house inside in a cardboard box.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Faced with a long shopping list from his formidable landlady, the hapless half-wit builds a giant motorised trolley from a petrol mower and pram wheels, hoping to get the job done in double-quick time.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben instead sets his sights on a Sumo Slammer collectible.

programme.title: Martin & Roman's Sunday Best!
programme.desc: Martin and Roman Kemp team up to present this entertainment show featuring celebrity chat, music and comedy, as well as a series of fun challenges to find out whether father or son will come out on top. Their first guests are Joel Dommett, Ricky Wilson and Ade Adepitan.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James visits the Shetland Islands, an area of natural beauty that he's always wanted to see. He gets to hire a vintage car to explore the area, where he learns about traditional fish salting and cooks a tasty vegetable curry at a local social enterprise project. Later on, James learns all about Shetland community spirit and cake at one of their famous Sunday teas, and finally cooks up a Shetland-inspired paella on a beautiful local beach.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare a fish chowder served in a bread bowl, followed by handmade pasta with only three ingredients, and French toast berry muffins for dessert.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to Hull to transform the garden of a 90-year-old land girl and ballroom dancing devotee. Frailty has seen the twice-widowed great-grandmother lose the ability to tend her once beautiful gardens, so they have become neglected no-go areas. After Alan surprises her at a tea dance, the team transforms her gardens into spaces she can safely tend to again.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Filmed by his wife Alison, Alan shares the secrets to creating a picture-perfect lettuce patch, even when space is tight, and there are tips and advice from the rest of the Love Your Garden team from their own gardens across the country. Frances Tophill adds flowers with pest-fighting power to her tiny vegetable plot, Katie Rushworth shows how to construct a vertical garden that will suit any budget and David Domoney looks ahead to autumn and demonstrates how to make a sweetcorn and pumpkin patch.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at free diving in Cornwall and Liz Bonnin works with a team of volunteers at Cuan Wildlife Rescue centre in Shropshire caring for injured birds. Lesley Joseph indulges her love of stately homes as she turns guide for the day at Osterley Park in Middlesex and John Whaite travels back home to Lancashire and the family farm he grew up on to cook up some Eccles cakes.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: In a reality TV special, former Gogglebox star and 2016 Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt takes on 2019 Love Island contestant Curtis Pritchard. The pair - along with their families - go head to head in the knockout tournament, hoping to advance to the next round. Presented by Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: More mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Black Widow, Leopard, Flamingo and Panda take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong, try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Colwyn Bay, North Wales, where Helen Gardiner finds a diamond ring and Jan Keyne discovers some classic Moorcroft.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Take Your Pick. A selection of plucky audience members go up against the gong and play the famous Yes/No game as Alan bombards them with hilarious questions. One lucky player will then make it through to the brand-new epic endgame, and could take home a car. The show also features The Chase's Dark Destroyer, Shaun Wallace.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: TV presenters Fiona Bruce, Rick Edwards, Kate Humble and Joe Swash pit their general knowledge against a trivia expert as they try to win thousands of pounds for charity. However, they must work as a team to build their prize pot and stay one step ahead of the Chaser. Bradley Walsh hosts.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, Jyn Erso - the maverick daughter of scientist Galen Erso - joins the Rebel Alliance. On the planet Scarif, she and the freedom fighters, including a blind warrior and a deadpan droid, attempt to steal plans for the Death Star, a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds, which was designed by her father on behalf of the Empire. However, the Rebels face tough competition from Imperial warlord Orson Krennic and shadowy forces, including Darth Vader, who will come to play a major part in the rise of the Empire. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: The London Palladium: The Greatest Stage on Earth
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a documentary about the famous theatre, meeting some of the stars who have trod its boards, discovering the backstage secrets of its history, and uncovering archive footage of classic performances, including a long-lost recording of Morecambe and Wise. Featuring contributions from Stephen Fry, Sheila Hancock, Andrew Lloyd Webber, Beverley Knight and Phillip Schofield.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Live interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain

programme.title: Broadchurch

Meanwhile, Hardy finds an isolated clifftop hut that arouses his curiosity, the Latimers struggle to cope with their grief and the Rev Paul Coates decides to address the local media. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The presenter continues his epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter. He embarks on the second leg of his odyssey, beginning in Iceland before travelling to the icy wilderness of Greenland. Along the way, Alexander snorkels over a vast underwater crevasse separating two continental landmasses and wrestles with a female Viking. He also joins two Danish Special Forces soldiers and their huskies, who have the loneliest job on the planet, and witnesses an array of natural wonders.

A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part special to begin the second series, the actor and film-maker examines the real-life impact of dementia. He meets Scott Mitchell, the husband of his former on-screen mum Barbara Windsor, who was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease in 2014. Ross also travels to Leatherhead, Surrey, where he stays with Jerry Beckman, an actor, magician and keen sportsman who has early-onset dementia and Parkinson's disease.

A prize of £1,000 awaits the successful candidate.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Actor Warwick Davis talks to Piers about his life and career, which includes supporting roles in both the Harry Potter and Star Wars films. The actor and presenter opens up about the struggles he and his wife Sam faced when starting a family and offers an entertaining and revealing account of some of the routine realities of life as a little person, including the challenges of supermarket shopping and airline travel. He also reflects on his leading roles alongside Jennifer Aniston, Val Kilmer and Ricky Gervais, and talks about his work to support other people with dwarfism.
